title: fatal error: runtime.SetFinalizer: pointer not in allocated block
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.5.9 via maven-central
OS & Version: Android

#### Expected behaviour

should not crash

#### Actual behaviour

crashes with 'runtime.SetFinalizer: pointer not in allocated block'

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

unfortunately I did not yet find a way to reproduce - but perhaps the stacktrace helps. Also only got this error only once ( EDIT: twice ) so far

These look like Go runtime issues. Are you using a 64bit ARM CPU?

That might be - unfortunately I do not remember which device/emulator they happened on - but I can tell next time it happens. Would 64bit ARM be a problem? In the end it should run on 64bit arm as android is the target platform.
I asked because Go has a few known issues on ARM64.
Thats sad news - is there any way to medigate this? But status should have the same problem then ? cc @jarradh
@fjl @karalabe what do you think  about only including armeabi-v7a and not arm64-v8a as long as this problem exists?

I don't really want to say "Go is broken on ARM64" because that's not true in general. It looks like the 1.5.9 aar was [built with Go1.8rc3](https://travis-ci.org/ethereum/go-ethereum/jobs/201194503), a prerelease version.

Please use the go-ethereum 1.6-unstable aar as a workaround. We'll release 1.5.10 next week-ish and will make sure it gets built with a stable version. I can't do much more about this issue.
